MUSSELBURGH MOTTO
This is one of the version s of how Musselburgh got its motto of the "honest toun". The Earl of Mar, the most important earl in Scotland went to Wemyss Castle to have a feast. But he never realised that it was a plot to kill him. While his guards and himself were being served by servants, a monk poured a slow actin poison into his wine. When he was passing Wallyford the poison began to take effect. His guards went to get the magistrates from Musselburgh. They rushed him to Pinkie House. The towns folk looked after him but he died. He was taken to St Michael's Kirk. His nephew awarded the town the title "the honest toun"
